metadata.title: US ISO/RTO Electricity Supply Response Data
metadata.author: Bottlenecks Lab
metadata.notes: Prices are 2024 annual averages from ISO market monitor reports. ERCOT, SPP, and ISO-NE are day-ahead averages; MISO and PJM are real-time load-weighted averages; CAISO and NYISO are estimated from available reports. DA prices are typically $1–3/MWh higher than RT. Capacity additions are gross nameplate MW reaching commercial operation in 2024 (not net of retirements). Queue completion rates span 2000–2020 entry cohorts from LBNL Queued Up and Brattle/AEU Scorecard; ERCOT uses a narrower 2018–2020 cohort. Project counts are distinct generators (EIA-860M unit-level) reaching COD in 2024. All-in prices add capacity market payments (RPM, FCA, ICAP, RA, PRA) to energy-only wholesale averages.

isos.name: Electric Reliability Council of Texas
isos.qualitative_note: Energy-only market with streamlined interconnection. Added ~18.7 GW in 2024 — more than any other ISO — driven by solar, battery, and gas. Queue completion rate 3–5× higher than peers.

sources.price: E3 2024 ERCOT Market Update (ERCOT North Hub DA avg)
sources.capacity: E3; IEEFA; Dallas Fed; Amperon (9.7 GW solar, 4.4 GW battery, 3.4 GW gas, ~1.2 GW wind)

isos.name: Southwest Power Pool
isos.qualitative_note: Wind-dominated resource mix with lowest wholesale prices. Modest new additions in 2024 but historically strong wind buildout. Queue reforms underway.

sources.price: SPP 2024 Annual State of the Market Report (DA system avg)
sources.capacity: SPP ELCC Report; Amperon (1.2 GW wind, 0.5 GW solar, 0.8 GW battery)
sources.peak: SPP 2024 State of the Market (est. ~3% below 2023)

isos.name: Midcontinent ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Largest US ISO by geographic footprint. Solar installations doubled in 2024. Queue reforms (MTEP cycles) improving throughput, but ~70% of projects still never reach fruition.

sources.price: Potomac Economics 2024 MISO State of the Market (RT avg LMP)
sources.capacity: MISO confirmed 7.5 GW to COD in 2024 (Brattle); ~6.7 GW solar, ~0.8 GW wind+other
sources.queue: Concentric Energy Advisors; LBNL Queued Up

isos.name: California ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Battery storage leader — added 4.2 GW of batteries in 2024. High additions driven by state mandates, but only ~10% of queue projects reach operation. Duck curve dynamics suppress midday prices.

sources.price: CAISO DMM Q3/Q4 2024 Quarterly Reports (est. annual DA avg)
sources.capacity: CAISO 2024 Battery Storage Special Report; Amperon (4.2 GW battery, 3 GW solar)
sources.queue: Concentric Energy Advisors; LBNL Queued Up

isos.name: PJM Interconnection
isos.qualitative_note: Largest US ISO by peak demand. Data center load growth outpacing new supply. Queue backlog of 260+ GW with only 12% completion rate. 'Speed to power' crisis identified by RMI.

sources.price: Monitoring Analytics 2024 PJM State of the Market (RT LW avg LMP)
sources.capacity: PJM SOM; Amperon (4.5 GW solar, 0.29 GW wind, 43 MW storage)
sources.queue: LBNL Queued Up; RMI; Brattle Scorecard

isos.name: New York ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Extreme zonal price divergence — NYC (Zone J) averages ~$50+/MWh while upstate ~$25. Minimal new supply despite CLCPA mandates. Offshore wind procurement delays and Article 10 siting friction.

sources.price: NYISO 'Impact of National & Global Conditions on Electricity Prices in New York' white paper (2024 avg wholesale price)
sources.capacity: NYISO Winter Assessment; ESAI Power (~452 MW pre-summer, ~935 MW total)

isos.name: ISO New England
isos.qualitative_note: Energy + FCA capacity cost ~$51/MWh (comparable basis). Published $87/MWh total includes RECs, RGGI, ancillary, and transmission. Vineyard Wind delivered only 136 MW before construction pause. Gas dependence + pipeline constraints drive winter price spikes. Worst queue completion rate nationally.

sources.price: ISO-NE Internal Market Monitor 2024 Annual Markets Report (DA avg)
sources.capacity: ISO Newswire; Vineyard Wind (136 MW offshore wind, ~200 MW solar, ~64 MW other)
